description: The Becoming a Linux System Administrator covers managing Linux systems in a business environment. Topics covered include installing Linux, managing software and using centralized user directories among others. The primary goal of the course is to highlight the differences in managing Linux machines in a business environment versus stand-alone or home systems.
descriptionMD: The *Becoming a Linux System Administrator* covers managing Linux systems in a business environment. Topics covered include installing Linux, managing software and using centralized user directories among others. The primary goal of the course is to highlight the differences in managing Linux machines in a business environment versus stand-alone or home systems.
name: Becoming a Linux System Admin
subtitle: Becoming a Linux System Admin

episodes.description: The Becoming a Linux Power User covers managing Linux systems in a business environment. Topics covered include installing Linux, managing software and using centralized user directories among others. The primary goal of the course is to highlight the differences in managing Linux machines in a business environment versus stand-alone or home systems.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Don explore graphical tools that can be used to help manage systems. First, they look at OS integrated features such as, system-config commands. Next, they look at tools specific to the window manager GNOME. Lastly, they cover some web based third party tools such as Webmin, Cockpit, and CUPS.
episodes.title: Graphical Administration Tools

episodes.description: In this episode Don and Cherokee define the root user account. Don explains the high level access this account carries and suggests using it on an as needed basis. He demonstrates a couple of alternative methods of temporary elevated access such as using superuser (sd) and superuser do (sudo). Don also suggests using a syntax checker (visudo) to help prevent typos.
episodes.title: The root User Account

episodes.description: In this show, Cherokee and Don focus on command to manage systems. First, Don explains the different folder locations such as /sbin and /usr/sbin he also explains the importance of certain files the system requires to boot. They also discuss additional locations one may find helpful tools. Many tools are demonstrated including the tools listed in the /etc folder.
episodes.title: Administrative Commands

episodes.description: In this show, Don and Cherokee continue to examine helpful administrative commands. They specifically focus on system logs. Don explains how journald is making its way into the market but may not be supported by all applications thus making it important to also check syslogd for important log information.
episodes.title: Administrative Commands Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Don focus on hardware. They explain how the system detects and identifies different components. They look at how to identify if hardware is working properly by using tools such as dmessage and journalctl. Doe demonstrates how hardware should be detected by udevd. He also explains how overrides can be used as well as using ls to list different buses.
episodes.title: Configuring Hardware

episodes.description: In this show, Don and Cherokee continue to discuss hardware. First, they look at drivers and Don demonstrates how to use lsmod to view loaded modules. He also shows additional how to obtain additional info using modinfo, -v, -vv and more.
episodes.title: Configuring Hardware Part 2

episodes.description: In this show, Don and Cherokee prepare for an Ubuntu installation. Don explains where to download the installation file, which version may be right for you and how to prepare a USB for a bootable install.
episodes.title: Installing Ubuntu

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don continue walking you through installing Ubuntu Linux. Here they will demonstrate and explain booting from usb media to launch the installer, explain the different installation types, configure\partition the hard disk, and create the 1st user account.
episodes.title: Installing Ubuntu Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don finish walking you through installing Ubuntu Linux. Here they will demonstrate finishing up the install, perform software and kernel updates, and look for any hardware errors that would need troubleshooting with dmesg.
episodes.title: Installing Ubuntu Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don begin walking you through installing Fedora Linux as your Operating System. Here they show you how to obtain the Fedora Linux installation software as well as creating a bootable usb key with dd while explaining how to use RawWrite32 or the Fedora Media Writer for Win32 and/or Mac users.
episodes.title: Installing Fedora

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don continue walking you through installing Fedora Linux. Here they demonstrate how to boot the installation media from a usb key, explore configuring the hard disk partitions, configuring the time zone, and setting up network connectivity in the installer.
episodes.title: Installing Fedora Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don finish walking you through installing Fedora Linux. Here they will explore and explain logging in for the first time, and post-install administration like checking for hardware error with dmesg and installing software and/or kernel updates.
episodes.title: Installing Fedora Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Don take a look at performing an unattended installation of your Linux distro. Here they will explain and explore how to use Kickstart to build an answer file which will answer all the necessary configuration questions for a light-touch install. Then they will show you how to deploy your Kickstart answer file to install the OS.
episodes.title: Enterprise Installations

episodes.description: Don and Zach discuss what 'Dual Booting' is, what are the considerations/gotchas involved in setting up and using, virtualization, configuring Dual Boot, and maintenance considerations of a Dual Boot config.
episodes.title: Dual Booting

episodes.description: Don and Zach conclude the discussion on considerations of using Dual Boot configurations on various 'Distros' & operating systems, using SELinux, configuring 'Grub,' and pushing changes to Grub.
episodes.title: Dual Booting Part 2

episodes.description: Don and Zach discuss what 'Apt" is, why we would need a utility like Apt, using 'Apt-Get' to acquire software and track dependencies, upgrading and installing packages, acquiring 3rd party software, how we remove packages once installed, Apt repositories, and what 'Aptitude' is.
episodes.title: Managing Software with Apt

episodes.description: Don and Zach discuss the utilities of YUM & DNF, history of them, differences between the two, how to use the utilities, where we can acquire software from, using 'Checksum, using the 'Repository,' installing software, and importing the "Signing Key."
episodes.title: Managing Software with YUM/DNF

episodes.description: Don and Zach cover how we create user accounts and why, deleting or changing user accounts, creating or changing passwords for users, deleting passwords or forcing expiration, where new user log-in default settings come from, and how administrators get info about user accounts in system.
episodes.title: Creating User Accounts

episodes.description: Don and Zach discuss why we need groups, how we create them, how we use them, and how as an administrator we can access info to see what groups a user is part of.
episodes.title: Understanding Group Accounts

episodes.description: Don and Zach discuss what Advanced Permissions are, how they differ from Basic Permissions, what we need two sets of permissions, how we create users, create groups, filesystem Access Control Lists, what 'ACL' is, how to enable the ACL, assigning permissions for a user, assigning permissions for a group, directory permissions, and what a 'Sticky Bit' is.
episodes.title: Advanced Permissions

episodes.description: Don and Zach discuss what partitioning systems are, why they are useful, MBR partitions, GPT partitions, how to use these systems, partitioning an MBR disk, using 'Gdisk' for GPT disks, and other tools to use for partitioning,
episodes.title: Partitioning Disks

episodes.description: Don and Zach cover selecting a filesystem when formatting disks, different filesystems & their functionality, creating a filesystem, formatting a filesystem, resizing filesystems, mounting & un-mounting partitions, making mounting changes permanent, and mount points.
episodes.title: Formatting and Mounting Disks

episodes.description: Don and Zach discuss what LVM is, why we would choose LVM over other traditional volumes, how we use LVM, creating physical volumes, creating a volume group, formatting and mounting logical volume, adding storage to volume group, maintenance, how we make mount permanent, and how we can remove mount.
episodes.title: Using LVM
